trustfund:
TF092337-TJ - EMERGENCY FOOD SECURITY
            AND SEED IMPORTS PROJECT

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Emergency Food Security
            and Seed Imports Project for Tajikistan were as follows:
            outcomes were satisfactory, risk to development outcome was
            moderate, Bank performance was satisfactory, and Borrower
            performance was satisfactory. Some lessons learned included:
            establishment of the community production groups (CPGs) and
            community seed funds as the coordinating mechanism and
            umbrella organizations proved to be positively accepted and
            understood by beneficiaries. This form of cooperation during
            the course of land reforms can be extended at later stages
            and viewed as the first step to successfully establishing
            producers or farmers association. Close coordination between
            all parties can be invaluable to a projects success.
            Effective project management and good support from food and
            agriculture organization of the United Nations (FAO)
            headquarters resulted in the timely delivery of seed and
            fertilizer to Dushanbe. Local non-governmental organizations
            (NGOs) played a critical role in overall implementation
            throughout the projects life, from selecting beneficiaries
            and distributing input packages to providing training and
            extension needs to the CPGs and other farmers and monitoring
            project implementation. Where the capacity and resources of
            local government are limited, project design that involves
            active local government support should be accompanied by an
            adequate allocation of project resources to guide and
            support local government in the implementation of these
            roles and responsibilities. Project teams need to be
            realistic in their expectations of the various processes,
            especially those concerning the procurement process and the
            time it can generally take to complete these processes
            including within the Bank.
